text: RT @RealGDT: As COVID adapts and mutates, preparation for the next pandemic starts now.https://t.co/WGljvCKjjn
@msymeonides @macroliter @melmillerphd I completely agree with that. Maybe 'the damn coronavirus' is the appropriate lab slang for it?

@msymeonides @macroliter @melmillerphd No. This is something that actually drives me nuts. 

SARS, COVID-19 --> disease

SARS-CoV-2 --> causative agent 

Influenza --> disease 

Influenza virus --> causative agent

And yes, there are no COVID-19 infections. There are only SARS-CoV-2 infections.

@WashburneAlex The problem is, in the short term this means we just need to add hours to our current workload. And the workload is already unsustainably high - especially for people who are responding to the pandemic. Which results in a lot of unhappiness and likely unwillingness to comply.
